mil.emp3.api.abstracts

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.emp3.api.abstracts.Container
      • mil.emp3.api.abstracts.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IContainer, IMap, IGeoBase, IGeoContainer

    public abstract class Map
extends Container
implements IMap
    Map represents the container that encapsulates the map displayed on the users screen. All overlays and Features are contained within the Map. Map is responsible for starting and displaying a map engine of users choice. An application can display multiple maps on the screen. Applications use either MapView or MapFragment to build and display a map.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Android Application that has the implementation of engineClassName (optional)
      protected java.lang.String engineClassName
      Class that implements IMapInstance and encapsulates a map engine

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(ICamera camera,
                      boolean animate,
                      java.lang.Object userContext)
               throws EMP_Exception
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method sets the map's camera therefore changing the viewing area of the map. The map registers for camera change events for the camera and will update the map viewing area on each change event.
        Specified by:
        setCamera in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        camera - This parameter must contain the new camera setting to be applied to map's viewing area.
        animate - If set to true then map will animate to the new position
        userContext - user defined object
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • getVisibility

        public VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target)

        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the object is not visible on the map and its child objects visibility state depend on their visibility state with other parent objects null - If the target object is not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • getVisibility

        public VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target,
                                         IContainer parent)
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method retrieves the visibility of the target object on the map.
        Specified by:
        getVisibility in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        target - The object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - A parent of the target object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        Returns:
        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be not visible on the map. The target objects actual visibility depends on its visibility setting under another parent if it has others. VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE_ANCESTOR_HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be visible on the map, however no ancestral path from the parent to this root map is visible. null - If the target (or parent) object are not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • editFeature

        public void editFeature(IFeature oFeature,
                        IEditEventListener listener)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method places the specified feature into edit mode and EditorMode changes to EDIT_MODE. Clicking (tapping) on the map to add coordinates to the feature's position list is not support while in edit mode. To allow map clicking to add corrdiantes use the drawFeature method.
        Specified by:
        editFeature in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature. The feature must have been place on the map previously.
        listener - A listener to handler the edit session events. This listener is unregistered when the edit session is completed or canceled.
        Throws:

      • drawFeature

        public void drawFeature(IFeature oFeature,
                        IDrawEventListener listener)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method instructs the map to draw the feature specified and EditorMode changes to DRAW_MODE. Drawing a feature is the only mechanism available to add coordinates to a features position list by clicking (taping) on the map. Canceling a draw operation of an existing feature will return the feature back to its original state.
        Specified by:
        drawFeature in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature. The feature can be a newly allocated feature or a feature that has already been placed on a map.
        listener - A draw event listener that will received the draw event. This listener will be unregistered when the draw completes or is canceled.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the map is already drawing or editing, or the map can't draw a feature of that type, or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK or SMART_LOCK.

      • drawFreehand

        public void drawFreehand(IGeoStrokeStyle initialStyle,
                         IFreehandEventListener listener)
                  throws EMP_Exception
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised. The user can use drag gestures to draw lines on the map.

        When entering freehand mode:
        1) - The map is locked in smart lock mode.
        2) - A MAP_ENTERED_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE event is generated.
        3) - At the first drag gesture a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_START is generated when the first N points (N > 1) have been drawn. As the drawing takes place a line with the specified style is displayed on the map.
        4) - A MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_UPDATE event is generated as the user continues the drag gesture.
        5) - When the user ends the drag gesture (lifts the finger or stylist), a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_END event is generated. The event shall contain a list of geospatial coordinates of the line drawn. Once the event return the line is removed from the map, and the list of coordinates is deleted.
        6) - The user may choose to initiate a new drag gesture to generate a new line therefore returning to step # 3.
        7) - When drawComplete is called a MAP_EXIT_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE is generated, the map is unlocked, 8) - EditorMode changes to INACTIVE. and the map exits freehand draw mode.
        Specified by:
        drawFreehand in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - This parameters contains the initial style to use for the draw. A value of null causes an EMP_Exception.
        listener - This parameters is an event listener to handle the freehand draw events.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map does not support freehand drawing, or there is a draw or edit in progress, map is MapMotionLockMode is LOCKED or SMART_LOCK.

      • setFarDistanceThreshold

      • setMidDistanceThreshold

        public void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers. Icons at distances less than this threshold get displayed as fully qualified icons as per the label setting on the map. Note that this is simply a hint for the system. If EMP core components detect a high level of memory usage this value will be adjusted in the hope of avoiding OutofMemoryError. When memory usage returns to normal an attempt is made to restore the threshold to user set value Current default is 10000.0 meters.
        Specified by:
        setMidDistanceThreshold in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getMidDistanceThreshold

        public double getMidDistanceThreshold()
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method retrieves the mid distance threshold set by setMidDistanceThreshold. It is not necessarily the value that is actually in effect. Please see notes on setMidDistanceThreshold.
        Specified by:
        getMidDistanceThreshold in interface IMap
        Returns:
        The distance in meters.

      • getFontSizeModifier

        Specified by:
        getFontSizeModifier in interface IMap
        Returns:
        FontSizeModifierEnum

      • setFontSizeModifier

        public void setFontSizeModifier(FontSizeModifierEnum value)
                         throws EMP_Exception
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method is used to apply a scale factor to the font size of all Text and Tactical Graphics features when rendered on the map. The default setting is FontSizeModifierEnum.NORMAL. All features affected get re-rendered with the font size increased or decreased according to this setting.
        Specified by:
        setFontSizeModifier in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        value - FontSizeModifierEnum
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception

      • showMiniMap

        public android.view.View showMiniMap()
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method creates a mini map associated with the map. The android View containing the map is returned to the client. It is the responsibility of the client to add the view to a parent. All touch events are forwarded to the parent of the View. If the mini map has already been created the same view is returned.
        Specified by:
        showMiniMap in interface IMap
        Returns:
        android.view.View

      • hideMiniMap

        public void hideMiniMap()
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method destroys the mini map. The call will remove the view from its parent if it still has a parent. If the mini map has already been destroyed no action is taken.
        Specified by:
        hideMiniMap in interface IMap

      • setBackgroundBrightness

        public void setBackgroundBrightness(int setting)
        Description copied from interface: IMap
        This method set the brightness of the background maps on the map.
        Specified by:
        setBackgroundBrightness in interface IMap
        Parameters:
        setting - Range 0 - 100. 0 Black, 100 white. Values less than 0 are set to 0, and values greater then 100 are set to 100.
